attributes.action: Scrap plans for a blanket national speed limit reduction from 60 to 50mph
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Please see Times Story

http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/driving/article5864847.ece 

A blanket reduction in speed limit enforced by average speed cameras is a ridiculous way to try and reduce the deaths on the roads. Speed is not the only contributing factor in road traffic accidents, but is the only issue cameras can ever detect. 

We, the undersigned, believe this scheme should be scrapped. 

If there is money available for schemes to cut road deaths, it would be better spent on employing more traffic police and driver education.
